pages.about: Art Odyssey | about us Art Odyssey About usContacts Discover Art Odyssey Immerse Yourself in a World of Creativity and Culture Latest News New Exhibition: "Modern Masters Unveiled" Explore groundbreaking works by modern masters in our latest exhibition. Discover innovative perspectives and bold artistic statements from artists around the globe. Join us for an immersive journey into contemporary artistry. Art Workshop Series: Enhance Your Skills Join our upcoming series of art workshops designed for all skill levels. Learn techniques from professional artists and unleash your creativity in a supportive environment. Spaces are limited, so reserve your spot today! Community Outreach: Art in Schools Program We're excited to launch our new initiative bringing art education to local schools. Through interactive sessions and guided tours, we aim to inspire the next generation of artists and foster a deeper appreciation for cultural diversity. Our Sponsors and Patrons At Art Odyssey, we are profoundly grateful for the generous support of our sponsors and patrons. Their contributions help us to fulfill our mission of bringing world-class art exhibitions, educational programs, and cultural events to our community. Major Sponsors Our major sponsors play a crucial role in the success of our museum. Their significant financial support enables us to host landmark exhibitions and undertake ambitious projects. We extend our deepest thanks to: The Arts Foundation: A longstanding partner, The Arts Foundation supports our major exhibitions and outreach programs, helping us to reach diverse audiences. Global Bank: Their sponsorship has funded the renovation of our Main Building, ensuring that our galleries offer the best possible experience for visitors. Tech Innovators Inc.: Supporting our digital initiatives, Tech Innovators Inc. has helped us develop virtual tours and online resources, making art accessible to people everywhere. Patrons of the Arts Our patrons' dedication to art and culture is invaluable. Their contributions, whether through financial donations or in-kind support, help sustain our daily operations and special projects. We are honored to recognize: John and Mary Smith: Lifelong art lovers, the Smiths have generously donated to our Education Center, fostering creativity and learning for all ages. The Green Family Trust: Their support has made it possible to expand our outdoor sculpture garden, adding new pieces and enhancing the visitor experience. Anonymous Patron: We are deeply grateful to our anonymous patron whose substantial contributions have funded our community engagement programs, bringing art into local schools and neighborhoods. Explore Art Odyssey Online Welcome to Art Odyssey's Virtual Museum, where art meets innovation from the comfort of your home. Our virtual museum offers an immersive experience that allows you to explore our collections, exhibitions, and educational content online. Browse through our extensive collection of artworks from different periods and styles. Whether you're interested in Renaissance paintings, modern sculptures, or contemporary installations, our virtual museum provides high-resolution images and detailed descriptions for an enriching exploration. Experience our exhibitions virtually with interactive tours and 360-degree views. Navigate through gallery spaces, zoom in on artworks, and learn about their historical and cultural significance through curated narratives and audio guides. Enhance your art knowledge with our educational resources, including virtual lectures, artist interviews, and behind-the-scenes insights. Engage with multimedia content that deepens your understanding of art movements, techniques, and artists featured in our museum. Masterpieces of Art Odyssey At Art Odyssey, we are proud to showcase an exceptional collection of masterpieces that captivate and inspire our visitors. Here are three of our most celebrated works: "The Eternal Muse" by Isabella Seraphine This exquisite painting by renowned artist Isabella Seraphine captures the timeless beauty and grace of the human form. "The Eternal Muse" features a strikingly lifelike figure, adorned with delicate details and vibrant colors that draw viewers into a world of elegance and serenity. The painting's ethereal quality and masterful technique make it a true highlight of our collection. "Harmony in Stone" by Aiden Wainwright Aiden Wainwright's "Harmony in Stone" is a breathtaking marble sculpture that embodies the perfect balance between strength and fluidity. This monumental piece depicts intertwined figures, their forms seamlessly blending into one another in a dance of unity and grace. The sculpture's smooth, polished surface and intricate craftsmanship invite viewers to explore its every curve and contour, making it a standout work in our Sculpture Hall. "Celestial Reflections" by Lila Nakamura Lila Nakamura's "Celestial Reflections" is a mesmerizing installation that combines light, glass, and mirrors to create an otherworldly experience. This immersive artwork transforms an entire room into a shimmering galaxy of reflections and refractions, captivating visitors with its dynamic interplay of light and color. "Celestial Reflections" offers a unique and transformative experience, inviting viewers to contemplate the infinite possibilities of art and the universe. Visit Art Odyssey Discover the beauty and wonder of art at Art Odyssey. Our museum offers an unparalleled experience where creativity and culture come to life. Whether you're an art enthusiast or a curious explorer, there's something for everyone at Art Odyssey. Visit us Privacy policyTerms of usage Art Odyssey 2024
pages.contacts: Art Odyssey | contacts Art Odyssey About usContacts Discover Art Odyssey Immerse Yourself in a World of Creativity and Culture Meet Our Director Dr. Emily Hartman At the helm of Art Odyssey is Dr. Emily Hartman, a distinguished art historian and passionate advocate for cultural enrichment. With over 20 years of experience in the art world, Dr. Hartman brings a wealth of knowledge and a visionary approach to our museum. Dr. Hartman holds a Ph.D. in Art History from the University of Cambridge, where her research focused on Renaissance art and its influence on modern aesthetics. She has curated numerous high-profile exhibitions and has published extensively in leading art journals. Since joining Art Odyssey in 2010, Dr. Hartman has been instrumental in transforming our museum into a vibrant cultural hub. Her vision is to make art accessible to all and to foster a deep appreciation for diverse artistic traditions. Under her leadership, Art Odyssey has expanded its collection, launched innovative educational programs, and established partnerships with renowned institutions worldwide. Dr. Hartman is deeply committed to engaging with our local community. She believes in the power of art to inspire and educate, and she actively works to make Art Odyssey a welcoming space for everyone. Her initiatives include outreach programs in local schools, free admission days, and inclusive events that bring people together through art. Visitor Reviews Jane Smith Art Odyssey is an absolute gem! The exhibitions are thoughtfully curated and beautifully displayed. I especially loved the interactive installations and the sculpture garden. It's a must-visit for anyone interested in art. Michael Johnson I brought my family to Art Odyssey and we had a fantastic time. The kids loved the educational workshops, and we all enjoyed exploring the diverse range of artworks. The staff were incredibly friendly and knowledgeable. We will definitely be back! Emily Brown As an art student, I found Art Odyssey to be an invaluable resource. The collection is diverse and inspiring, and the library in the Education Center is a great place for research. The museum's atmosphere is welcoming and conducive to creativity. David Lee Art Odyssey exceeded my expectations. The blend of classical and contemporary art is impressive, and the exhibitions are always fresh and exciting. The park and outdoor sculptures provide a peaceful escape. Highly recommend visiting! Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) Q1: What are the museum's opening hours? A1: Art Odyssey is open from Tuesday to Sunday, 10:00 AM to 6:00 PM. We are closed on Mondays and major holidays. Q2: How can I purchase tickets? A2: Tickets can be purchased online through our website or at the museum's entrance. We accept major credit cards, debit cards, and cash. Q3: Is the museum accessible to visitors with disabilities? A3: Yes, Art Odyssey is fully accessible to visitors with disabilities. We have ramps, elevators, and accessible restrooms. Wheelchairs are available at the entrance upon request. Q4: Are guided tours available? A4: Yes, we offer guided tours for individuals and groups. You can book a tour in advance through our website or at the visitor services desk. Tours are available in multiple languages. Q5: Can I take photographs inside the museum? A5: Photography is allowed in most areas of the museum for personal use only. However, flash photography, tripods, and selfie sticks are not permitted. Please check for signage indicating areas where photography is restricted. Our International Branches Art Odyssey is proud to extend its cultural footprint beyond borders with several international branches, each offering a unique blend of local and global artistry. Our branches serve as cultural hubs in major cities worldwide, enriching communities with diverse exhibitions, educational programs, and collaborative initiatives. Nestled in the heart of Paris, Maison de l'Art embodies the essence of French artistic heritage while embracing contemporary innovations. Located near the Seine River, this branch features galleries showcasing iconic works from Impressionism to modern art movements. Visitors can enjoy exclusive exhibitions, participate in cultural workshops, and indulge in Parisian-inspired art events. Contacts +91 901 5178123 artodyssey@gmail.com Station Rd, Puri, Odisha 752002 Your name Your email Message I accept Privacy Policy Privacy policyTerms of usage Art Odyssey 2024
pages.index: Art Odyssey Art Odyssey About usContacts Discover Art Odyssey Immerse Yourself in a World of Creativity and Culture About Art Odyssey Welcome to Art Odyssey, where art comes to life. Our museum is dedicated to celebrating the rich tapestry of artistic expression from around the world. Explore a diverse collection of masterpieces spanning centuries, from classical to contemporary art. Immerse yourself in our exhibitions, workshops, and educational programs designed to inspire creativity and foster cultural understanding. Join us on a journey through the realms of art and discover new perspectives that enrich the soul. Current Exhibitions Masters of the Renaissance Discover the brilliance of Renaissance art through iconic works of Da Vinci, Michelangelo, and more. Contemporary Visions Explore cutting-edge art forms and interpretations from today's most innovative artists. Impressionist Landscapes Immerse yourself in the serene beauty of landscapes captured by the Impressionist masters. Women in Art: Pioneers & Innovators Celebrate the contributions of women artists throughout history in this empowering exhibition. Sculptures of Myth and Legend Marvel at sculptures that bring ancient myths and legends to life with intricate detail. Photography: Capturing Moments Experience the world through the lens of photographers capturing diverse cultures and scenes. Abstract Expressions Delve into the world of abstract art and explore its emotional depth and expressive power. Art of the Silk Road Journey through history and cultures along the Silk Road through exquisite artworks and artifacts. Our Story Art Odyssey began as a dream to create a space where art and culture could flourish and inspire. Founded in 1890, our museum was established by a group of passionate art enthusiasts dedicated to bringing the world's artistic treasures to our community. Their vision was to create a place where people could experience the transformative power of art. Over the years, Art Odyssey has grown its collection to include over 2000 pieces spanning various periods, styles, and cultures. From the timeless works of classical masters to the bold creations of contemporary artists, our collection reflects the rich diversity of human expression. Each piece in our collection has been carefully selected to offer visitors a broad perspective on the art world. In our early years, Art Odyssey focused primarily on local exhibitions and events. However, as our reputation grew, we began to attract international attention. We formed partnerships with museums and galleries worldwide, allowing us to host traveling exhibitions and exchange programs. This has enabled us to bring global art experiences to our visitors and showcase our collection to a broader audience. A core part of our mission has always been to engage with our community. We offer a variety of educational programs, workshops, and outreach initiatives designed to make art accessible to everyone. Our museum is a place where people of all ages and backgrounds can come together to learn, create, and be inspired. We are proud to be a cultural hub that enriches our community through art. Tickets Experience the magic of Art Odyssey by purchasing tickets to our exclusive exhibitions. Whether you're a seasoned art lover or new to the art world, our museum offers something for everyone. Book your tickets now and embark on a journey through creativity and culture. Colors of the Modern World Dive into the vibrant and dynamic world of modern art. This exhibition showcases bold and colorful works from artists who have redefined the contemporary art scene. Tickets are selling fast, so don't miss out on this visual feast. Ancient Civilizations: Artifacts and Art Step back in time and explore the art and artifacts of ancient civilizations. From the treasures of Egypt to the wonders of Mesopotamia, this exhibition offers a fascinating glimpse into the past. Secure your tickets today for an unforgettable historical journey. The Art of Nature Celebrate the beauty of the natural world through stunning artworks that capture the essence of landscapes, flora, and fauna. This exhibition features paintings, sculptures, and photography that highlight the wonders of nature. Get your tickets now and immerse yourself in nature's artistry. Portraits Through the Ages Discover the evolution of portraiture from the Renaissance to the present day. This exhibition features masterful portraits that tell the stories of individuals and their times. Purchase your tickets to witness the rich history and diversity of portrait art. Discounts and Benefits At Art Odyssey, we believe in making art accessible to everyone. To ensure that all members of our community can enjoy our exhibitions and programs, we offer a range of discounts and benefits. Senior Discounts Visitors aged 65 and older receive a 20% discount on all tickets. Simply present a valid ID at the time of purchase to enjoy this benefit. Student Discounts Students with a valid student ID receive a 30% discount on tickets. This discount is available both online and at the museum's entrance. Family Pass Families can take advantage of our Family Pass, which provides admission for two adults and up to three children under the age of 18 at a reduced rate of $40. Enjoy a day of art and culture together. Free Admission Days On the first Sunday of every month, admission to the museum is free for all visitors. This is our way of giving back to the community and ensuring that everyone has the opportunity to experience art. Membership Benefits Become a member of Art Odyssey and enjoy year-round free admission, exclusive previews of new exhibitions, discounts on workshops and events, and a 10% discount at our museum shop. Memberships start at just $60 per year. Group Discounts We offer special rates for groups of 10 or more. Whether you're planning a school trip, corporate outing, or a family gathering, contact our visitor services to learn more about our group packages. Explore Our Grounds Main Building The heart of Art Odyssey, our Main Building, houses the majority of our permanent collection and temporary exhibitions. This architectural marvel combines classical design with modern elements, providing spacious and well-lit galleries that enhance the art-viewing experience. Inside, you'll find our visitor services desk, museum shop, and a cozy café serving refreshments and light meals. Sculpture Hall Adjacent to the Main Building, the Sculpture Hall is dedicated to three-dimensional art. Featuring a vast collection of sculptures from different eras and cultures, this space allows visitors to engage with art in an interactive and tactile way. The hall's open layout and natural lighting make it a perfect venue for appreciating the intricate details of each piece. Education Center Our Education Center is the hub for all educational programs and workshops. Equipped with state-of-the-art facilities, this building hosts art classes, lectures, and interactive sessions for visitors of all ages. The center also includes a library with a comprehensive collection of art books and resources for students and researchers. Art Odyssey Park Surrounding our buildings is the beautiful Art Odyssey Park, a tranquil green space designed for relaxation and inspiration. Stroll through winding paths lined with contemporary outdoor sculptures, or enjoy a picnic in one of the designated areas. The park features a serene pond, blooming gardens, and plenty of seating areas where you can unwind and reflect on your museum visit. Privacy policyTerms of usage Art Odyssey 2024
pages.privacy_policy: Art Odyssey | Privacy policy Art Odyssey Privacy policy Introduction Welcome to Art Odyssey. We value your privacy and are committed to protecting your personal information. This Privacy Policy outlines the types of information we collect, how we use it, and the measures we take to ensure your information is kept secure. Information We Collect When you visit our website, register for an account, sign up for our newsletter, or purchase tickets, we may collect personal information such as your name, email address, mailing address, phone number, and payment information. Additionally, we collect non-personal information to improve our services, including browser type and version, operating system, IP address, pages visited on our site, and the time and date of your visit. How We Use Your Information Your personal information is used to process transactions and send order confirmations, send newsletters and updates about upcoming events and exhibitions, respond to customer service requests and support needs, and improve our website and services based on your feedback. Non-personal information is used to analyze trends and usage patterns, enhance the user experience on our website, and monitor and improve site performance. Information Sharing and Disclosure We do not sell, trade, or otherwise transfer your personal information to outside parties, except when necessary to fulfill your requests or comply with legal requirements. We may share information with trusted third-party service providers who assist us in operating our website and conducting our business, as long as they agree to keep this information confidential. We may also share information with law enforcement agencies, regulatory bodies, or other parties as required by law. Data Security We implement a variety of security measures to protect your personal information. These measures include Secure Socket Layer (SSL) technology to encrypt sensitive information, regular malware scanning and security audits, and restricted access to personal information to authorized personnel only. Contact us If you have any questions, please contact us: artodyssey@gmail.com Privacy policyTerms of usage Art Odyssey 2024
pages.terms: Art Odyssey | Terms of usage Art Odyssey Terms of usage Introduction Welcome to Art Odyssey. By accessing and using our website, you agree to comply with and be bound by the following terms and conditions. Please read them carefully before using our site. If you do not agree with any part of these terms, please do not use our website. Use of Website By using our website, you warrant that you are at least 18 years old or are using the site under the supervision of a parent or guardian. You agree to use the site for lawful purposes only and in a way that does not infringe the rights of, restrict, or inhibit anyone else's use and enjoyment of the site. Intellectual Property All content on this website, including text, graphics, logos, images, and software, is the property of Art Odyssey or its content suppliers and is protected by international copyright and trademark laws. Unauthorized use of any content is prohibited. You may not reproduce, distribute, or create derivative works from any of the content without our express written permission. User Accounts When you create an account on our site, you agree to provide accurate and complete information. You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account and password and for restricting access to your computer. You agree to accept responsibility for all activities that occur under your account or password. Ticket Purchases and Refunds All ticket purchases are subject to our terms and conditions. Tickets purchased through our website are non-refundable unless otherwise stated. In the event of a canceled or rescheduled event, we will provide information on the available options, including refunds or exchanges. Contact us If you have any questions, please contact us: artodyssey@gmail.com Privacy policyTerms of usage Art Odyssey 2024
